paper_title: Class X Mathematics – Full Test Paper (Set 1)

questions.question: If $a = 2^2 \times 5^x$, $b = 2^2 \times 5 \times 7$, $c = 2^2 \times 5 \times 11$ and $\text{LCM}(a,b,c) = 7700$, then the value of $x$ is
The shortest distance (in units) of the point $(-6,4)$ from the $y$-axis is
If the lines given by $5x+ky=7$ and $10x+6y-9=0$ are parallel, then the value of $k$ is
A quadrilateral $PQRS$ is drawn to circumscribe a circle. If $PQ=8$ cm, $QR=6$ cm and $RS=5$ cm, then the length of $SP$ is
If $\sec\theta - \tan\theta = x$, then $\sec\theta + \tan\theta$ is equal to
Which one of the following is not a quadratic equation?
The diameter of a circle is $14$ cm. Find its area. $(\pi=\frac{22}{7})$
A card is drawn at random from a well-shuffled deck of $52$ playing cards. The probability of getting a red card is
If $\cos x=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}$ and $0^\circ\le x\le90^\circ$, then $x$ is
The HCF of two numbers is $12$ and their sum is $180$. The number of possible pairs is
The base area of a right circular cone is $154\text{ cm}^2$ and its height is $6$ cm. Its volume is [Image of right circular cone volume]
If the zeroes of $x^2+px+9$ are equal, then $p$ is
The area of a sector of radius $21$ cm subtended by $60^\circ$ is [Image of area of sector of a circle]
If $\triangle ABC \sim \triangle DEF$, $AB=5$ cm, $DE=10$ cm and $EF=8$ cm, then $BC$ is
A letter is chosen at random from the word \textit{PROBABILITY}. The probability that it is a vowel is
The points $A(1,2)$, $B(1,6)$, $C(5,6)$ and $D(5,2)$ are the vertices of a
The median of a set of observations is $18$. If each observation is decreased by $3$, then the new median is
The length of a tangent drawn from a point $26$ cm away from the centre of a circle of radius $10$ cm is

questions.assertion: A prime number greater than $2$ is always odd.
questions.reason: A prime number has exactly two distinct factors.
options: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

questions.assertion: The graph of a linear polynomial is a straight line.
questions.reason: A linear polynomial is of degree one.
options: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

parts.A: The A.P $6, 10, 14, \dots$ has $50$ terms. Find the sum of last $10$ terms.
parts.OR: Find the middle term of A.P $7, 14, 21, \dots, 287$

questions.question: If $\sin(A + B) = 1$ and $\cos(A - B) = \frac{1}{2}$, where $0^\circ < A, B < 90^\circ$, find the measure of angles $A$ and $B$.
If $AP$ and $DQ$ are medians of triangles $ABC$ and $DEF$ respectively, where $\triangle ABC \sim \triangle DEF$, then prove that $\frac{AB}{DE} = \frac{AP}{DQ}$.

parts.A: A horse, a cow and a goat are tied, each by ropes of length $21$ m, at the corners $A$, $B$ and $C$ respectively, of a grassy triangular field $ABC$ with sides of lengths $42$ m, $56$ m and $70$ m. Find the area of grass field that can be grazed by them.
parts.OR: Find the area of the major segment (in terms of $\pi$) of a circle of radius $7$ cm, formed by a chord subtending an angle of $60^\circ$ at the centre.

questions.question: A $\triangle ABC$ is drawn to circumscribe a circle of radius $5$ cm such that the segments $BD$ and $DC$ are of lengths $12$ cm and $10$ cm respectively. Find the lengths of the sides $AB$ and $AC$, if it is given that $\text{ar}(\triangle ABC) = 110\text{ cm}^2$.
questions.visually_impaired: A circle is inscribed in a right-angled triangle $ABC$, right angled at $B$. If $BC = 15$ cm and $AB = 20$ cm, find the radius of the circle.

questions.question: In Figure, $XY$ and $X'Y'$ are two parallel tangents to a circle with centre $O$ and another tangent $AB$ with point of contact $C$ intersecting $XY$ at $A$ and $X'Y'$ at $B$. Prove that $\angle AOB = 90^\circ$. [Image of parallel tangents to a circle]
questions.visually_impaired: Two tangents $PA$ and $PB$ are drawn to a circle with centre $O$ from an external point $P$. Prove that $\angle APB = 2(\angle OAB)$.

questions.question: In a workshop, the number of teachers of English, Hindi and Science are $48$, $72$ and $96$ respectively. Find the minimum number of rooms required, if in each room the same number of teachers are to be seated and all of them being of the same subject.
Find the zeroes of the quadratic polynomial $x^2 - 9x + 20$ and verify the relationship between the zeroes and coefficients of the polynomial.

parts.OR: Prove that $\frac{\cos A - \sin A + 1}{\cos A + \sin A - 1} = \sec A + \tan A$.

questions.question: On a particular day, Riya and Neha couldn’t decide on who would get to drive the car. They had one coin each and flipped their coin exactly two times. The following was agreed upon: (1) If Riya gets two heads, she would drive the car. (2) If Neha gets a head followed by a tail, she would drive the car. Who has greater probability to drive the car that day? Justify your answer.

parts.A: The monthly income of Aman and Rohit are in the ratio $5 : 6$ and their monthly expenditures are in ratio $4 : 5$. If each saves ₹$12,000$ per month, find their monthly incomes.
parts.OR: Solve the following system of equations graphically: $x + y = 8$, $x - y = 4$. Find the area of the triangle so formed by two lines and $x$-axis.

questions.visually_impaired: Five years hence, father’s age will be four times the age of son. Five years ago, father was six times as old as his son. Find their present ages.

questions.question: A bus travels a distance of $120$ km at a certain speed. It then travels another distance of $180$ km at a speed $10$ km/h more than the original speed. If the total time taken for the journey is $5$ hours, find the original speed of the bus.

Prove that if the diagonals of a parallelogram bisect each other, then it is a rectangle. Hence, in parallelogram $ABCD$, diagonals $AC$ and $BD$ intersect at $O$. If $AC = 26$ cm and one side of the parallelogram is $10$ cm, find the area of the parallelogram.

parts.A: A solid is composed of a cylinder surmounted by a hemisphere. The radius of both the cylinder and hemisphere is $7$ cm and the height of the cylindrical part is $10$ cm. Find the total surface area of the solid.
parts.OR: A solid right circular cone of height $14$ cm and base radius $7$ cm is melted and recast into a sphere. Find the radius of the sphere.

parts.A:
The following table shows the distribution of marks obtained by $100$ students in an examination:

| Class Interval | $0–20$ | $20–40$ | $40–60$ | $60–80$ | $80–100$ |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Frequency | $12$ | $28$ | $30$ | $20$ | $10$ |

Find the mean marks using step deviation method.
parts.OR:
The mean of the following frequency distribution is $50$. Find the missing frequency $x$.

| Class Interval | $0–20$ | $20–40$ | $40–60$ | $60–80$ | $80–100$ |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Frequency | $5$ | $10$ | $x$ | $15$ | $10$ |

questions.case_study:
Two students Ramesh and Suresh write two arithmetic progressions as:

Ramesh: $4, 9, 14, 19, \dots$

Suresh: $200, 195, 190, \dots$

parts.i: Find the common difference of both A.P.s.
parts.ii: Find the $25^{th}$ term of the A.P. written by Suresh.
parts.iii_A: Find the sum of first $12$ terms of the A.P. written by Ramesh.
parts.OR: Which term of both the A.P.s has the same value?

questions.case_study: The positions of three points $A$, $B$ and $C$ on a coordinate plane are given by $A(-2, 4)$, $B(2, 0)$ and $C(6, -4)$. [Image of coordinate geometry points]

parts.ii: Find the coordinates of the midpoint of $AC$.
parts.iii_A: Find the point on the $x$-axis which is equidistant from $A$ and $B$.
parts.OR: Find the coordinates of the point which divides $AB$ internally in the ratio $1 : 3$.

questions.case_study: A flagstaff stands on the top of a tower. The height of the tower is $20$ m and the height of the flagstaff is $5$ m.

parts.i: Find the angle of elevation of the top of the flagstaff from a point on the ground $15$ m away from the foot of the tower.
parts.ii: If the angle of elevation of the top of the tower from a point is $45^\circ$, find the distance of the point from the foot of the tower.
parts.iii_A: Find the distance of the point from the foot of the tower if the angle of elevation of the top of the flagstaff is $60^\circ$.
parts.OR: Find the height of the flagstaff if the angle of elevation of its top from a point $20$ m away from the foot of the tower is $45^\circ$.
